New Records: The starting pitching matchup between Simeon Woods Richardson and Spencer Schwellenbach marked the most combined letters in the last names of a starting pitching matchup in major league history, with 28 letters, surpassing the previous record of 25.
Key Match Events: Atlanta Braves scored four times in the 10th inning to beat the Minnesota Twins 8-6.
Michael Harris II hit a 2-run home run in the first inning.
Marcell Ozuna added two hits, including a two-run double in the fifth.
Trevor Larnach and Edouard Julien had RBI doubles and Matt Wallner added an RBI single in Minnesota's three-run seventh.
Larnach had three hits and drove in three runs.
Atlanta closer Raisel Iglesias blew a save after allowing Trevor Larnach's game-tying RBI double to score an inherited runner with two outs in the eighth.
Pierce Johnson allowed two runs in the 10th but struck out Matt Wallner with the tying run at first to end it.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Harris, who was hit on the hand by a pitch on Sunday, returned to the starting lineup for the Braves and homered in the second.
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota catcher Ryan Jeffers said it's really hard when these games are as valuable as they are, and you play clean ball the whole year, but it's really frustrating to have all that happen to us when the games are as important as they are.
Atlanta manager Brian Snitker said it was going to be a costly loss, quite honestly, but now it's a good win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Marcell Ozuna now has 98 RBIs, third in the majors behind New York Yankees outfielder Aaron Judge (122) and Cleveland Guardians third baseman José Ramírez (104).
The Twins have lost seven of nine and trail Cleveland and Kansas City by 2 1/2 games in the AL Central.
The Braves, who led 4-0 before the Twins rallied late, won for the eighth time in 10 games.
Others: Atlanta trails Philadelphia by 6 games in the National League East and hold the final wild-card spot in the NL by 3 1/2 games over the New York Mets.
